dev_note: DEV NOTE: Fully specified Quantum–Environmental Shrinkage Field (QESF) model following USMFv2 schema; added dynamic scalar field and environmental modulation; v1.0 initial release.
abstract: The Quantum–Environmental Shrinkage Field (QESF) cosmology introduces a light scalar φ whose dynamics and coupling to local density drive both a redshift-dependent shrinkage index and an environmental modulation of rulers. It computes the sound horizon self-consistently via φ-modulated photon–baryon physics, yielding jointly improved SNe Ia and BAO fits and a clear path toward quantum unification.
description:
### 1. Effective Scale Factor
Define $$\alpha(z) = [a_{bg}(z)]^{p(z)}\,[1+\delta(z)]$$ with $$p(z)=p_\infty+\Delta p\,e^{-\beta z},\quad \delta(z)=\delta_0\,(\rho_{loc}/\bar\rho)\,[1-e^{-\gamma z}].$$

### 2. Scalar-Field Dynamics
Lagrangian
$$\mathcal{L}=-\tfrac12(\partial\varphi)^2 - V(\varphi) - \tfrac14 B(\varphi)F^2 - \sum_\psi\bar\psi\gamma^\mu D_\mu\psi,$$
with $$V(\varphi)=V_0[1-e^{-\kappa\varphi}]^2 + V_1e^{-\lambda\varphi},\; B(\varphi)=e^{\xi\varphi}.$$ 

### 3. Sound Horizon
Compute $$r_s=\int_{z_{drag}}^\infty\frac{c_s(z)}{H(z)}dz$$ with $$c_s=\frac{c}{\sqrt{3(1+R)}},\;R=3\rho_b/(4\rho_\gamma e^{\xi\varphi}).$$

### 4. Observables & Fit
Distances $$D_L,D_A,D_V$$ follow standard integrals rescaled by α(z) and r_s. Joint χ² minimization over SNe Ia and BAO tunes {H_A,p_∞,Δp,β,δ_0,γ,V_0,V_1,κ,λ,ξ}.
notes: Structured QESF theory fields based on USMFv2 schema.
title: Quantum–Environmental Shrinkage Field Cosmology
